Speaker: bowling ball
Dialogue: A slow motion low tracking shot of a bowling ball hitting a polished lane.

Speaker: bowling pins
Dialogue: Close-up of the milky white surface of two bowling pins on opposite sides of the lane - a seven-ten split. The RUMBLING ball is heard in the distance like a furious hulking steamroller of doom. The pins begin to tremble, and then transform into a Bridal Ken and Barbie. The dolls burst into flame.

Speaker: ball
Dialogue: The ball blasts past the camera and metamorphoses into Theo's car.

Speaker: burning dolls
Dialogue: The flaming couple stand in the middle of the bridge. Theo's car hits the pair and they fly into the air in slow-motion. A distant SOUND of pins scattering is heard. The two dolls smoke as they spin into the sky, then hit the water with dual HISSES.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: I'm an addict. I can't go through a day without the stuff. Theo reaches over and pours for him with a steady hand.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: You're not from around here, are you?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm from Akron.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: You a bowler?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm looking for a man.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: What kind of man?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: A bowler.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Lane's closed big fellah, league night.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm not here to bowl.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: You drag that coconut around for your health, or do you know how to use it?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm looking for somebody.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Hey, ain't I seen you on the tour?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: No, pinhead, he ain't here to bowl.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm looking for Buzz Fazeli.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Fazeli...I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: What do you want with old man Faz?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Some unfinished business.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: If you wanna do business in this town, there's other people around here got more weight than old Faz.

Speaker: dwarf
Dialogue: Evening Sid, evening Breeze.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Evening Tina.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Good luck tonight Tina.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You guys got something going on downstairs?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: We provide some extracurricular activities for the senior citizens in the community.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Basement bingo?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Yeah, basement bingo.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Lemme see your ball.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Let go of my bag.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Ah, come on, lemme see your ball.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: You afraid we're gonna steal it?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I said, let go of my bag.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Aagh! Stop! Those are my bowling fingers!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Tell your little pal to let go.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Breeze, give him his ball back!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Where can I find Buzz Fazeli?

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Whoa, cool your maples. Over the bridge, past the Peter Pan, last house on the dead end. Theo releases Sid's hand. Sid drops to his knees and cradles his damaged hand.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It belonged to my dad.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Is Mr. Fazeli in please?

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Who wants to know?  Zeus!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm a bowler.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: I'm sick of you people. Why don't you leave him be?

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Oh sure. Let everyone in. From now on I leave the door wide open. Let the parade begin!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Clam it!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Hey, rat. C'mere.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Jerk.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Sit down.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Buzz Fazeli.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Theo.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I know your face, you're an up-and-comer. You bowl on the tour.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm not on the tour this year.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Need some advice, huh.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Well, Mr. Fazeli, the Bowling Congress says I'm a thorn in their side.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Don't worry about the Congress, they're just a bunch of moralistic busy-bodies.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Get that outta your mouth!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: They suspended me.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Why'd they suspend you?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I got suspended when I was young, too. I was pretty cocky in my day.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: They suspended me for 100 years.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: 100 years!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I can appeal in five. I was hoping you could help me Mr. Fazeli.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: What do you think I can do?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I need a sponsor to get my sanction card back. Where I come from, you're the king.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Sure, around here, any fat old bald guy could be king. I'm nothing. It wouldn't do any good for me to talk to the Congress.  Hey, you thirsty? You like orange whips?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I've never had orange whips, I'm from Akron.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: He's the guy Buzz.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: He's not the guy, Millie. Just whip the whips.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: I looked in his car. He's got pictures of you, clippings, maps.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Bowlers don't go around killing other bowlers. He's only a fan, Millie. I'll give him some tips and an autograph and he's outta here.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: You're in trouble, aren't you Buzz? You're doing something dangerous in that alley.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Millie, I know what I'm doing.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: We should leave this town. I can't take this anymore. I'm not gonna let him kill you in my house.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Remember the finals in Akron in '59? You had a seven-ten split in the final frame.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Yeah, against that prick VanDeMark.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Ten thousand to one, but you pegged it. The toughest shot on the last frame.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: That game was before you was born.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: My mom was there. She told me about it. The 'Fazeli Split.'

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: And the irony is, thirty years later, that prick is bowling in the seniors on TV all over the world, and look at me. Ah well. The docs made me stop, on account of my ticker.  ...I miss it.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Orange whip, nectar of the bowling gods. Thanks sweetie. Millie turns the tray so that Buzz takes the untainted whip.  Theo takes the other glass.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: zeus
Dialogue: Zeus is on the sofa, GROWLING and tugging at Theo's bowling bag. The bag rips apart and the ball hits the floor.

Speaker: orange whip
Dialogue: Theo brings the drink to his lips. The ball rolls across the room.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: The ball rolls into Buzz's feet.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: This your lucky bullet?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Where'd you get this ball?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It's mine.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Who gave it to you?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Grace Skinner.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Grace Skinner. Who's Grace Skinner to you?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: She's my mom.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Who are you? Who sent you here?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm your son. You're a hard father to find.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Son?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I don't have a son. I think you better leave now young man. Buzz gestures towards the front door.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Grace Skinner Fazeli, you must remember her?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I don't know no Grace Skinner.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Married?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You're a bullshit artist, that's what you are. You got no right to be here! Theo yanks the trophy away from Buzz.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I got a right. You're my father.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I ain't nobody's father!

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: ZEUS!

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: My poor baby!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Take your ball and get out.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: 15 hours, and 20 minutes of no bowling. Alfie shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wiping it down.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: Find your bowler?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Yeah, but it didn't go so good. He wasn't the man I thought he'd be. Theo is trying to affix the lid on his cup, but his hands are trembling, spilling some of the coffee.

Speaker: alfie
Dialogue: My father used to say to me "Never..." no, hmmm. "Always..." No, no...  Ah! Love and hate are blood relations.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Maybe I should have left the ball in the car.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: He's not here.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm sorry about Zeus, Millie.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: This is a sign! Someone's coming to take Buzz away from me. I don't know if you're the guy or what, but I'm not letting it happen. I'm leaving him first.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I couldn't kill Buzz. I need his help. Theo helps Millie load suitcases into the trunk of her car.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Buzz Fazeli never helps anybody but himself.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: He's my father, Millie.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: He's no father to you.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Where can I find him?

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: The Peter Pan.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: You tell Buzz I went to my sister's in Ronkonkoma. Oh, I'm sorry about trying to kill you last night, Theo. It was nothing personal. Millie puts on a pair of sunglasses and patches out in a cloud of gravel and dust.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: How's that orange whip comin'?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Cup of joe Mr. Fazeli?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Yeah, and make it extra muddy, I didn't sleep a zee last night. Sheila fills a cup. Buzz lifts it to his mouth, his hands trembling.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: You don't need coffee, Mr. Fazeli; you need a vacation. Sheila catches sight of Theo pulling into the parking lot. She puts a Ken head earring in her right ear. Buzz follows Sheila's gaze.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Some people will do anything for an autograph. Theo enters the diner and walks over to Buzz.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Millie left to stay with her sister in Ronkonkoma.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You know what a mixer ball is? It's like you, you come out of nowhere and upset things, scattering everything all over. Buzz grumpily waves at him to sit.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What are you doing over at the lanes that's so dangerous, Buzz?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You shouldn't listen to her, she's a nervous old Nellie.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: She thinks someone's trying to kill you.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I couldn't pay someone enough to try to kill me. Sheila comes over to take their orders.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I'll have my usual please, Sheila.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Buzz Burger, side of 'cues. You haven't introduced me to your fan.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Sheila, meet...uh...  I forget the name.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Theo.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Theo! This is Sheila Kastle, my partner's daughter.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: You look like you're something on the lanes.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Theo's bowled on the tour.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Oh, a professional man. What'll you have?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What's your specialty?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Whips...orange whips.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Then I'll have the number four with one of your finest whips.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: How do you want it?  The eggs.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Uh...over easy.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Coming right up.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Watch out for that one. She's got a great average, but she's looking for a prince. And, believe me, she's

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: kissed a lotta tadpoles.  Putt-putt golf.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Putt-putt golf?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: It's the next level, the next dimension...  ...the small ball.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: The small ball.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: It's gonna be bigger than big. Think Europe. Think Asia. They don't have room for real golf courses in Japan.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Not for me. Miniature golf's for pansies.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: If the Japanese are pansies, then pansies are my kind of people. Sheila steps over to the booth with their food. The Buzz Burger has three holes cut in the middle to make it look like a bowling ball. Buzz sees the two sleazeballs park their car and walk towards the diner.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Maybe I could bowl in Japan.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I gotta wash up.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Three whips. To go.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: When you get a chance.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Hey, you still here?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: We're looking for Buzz Fazeli, seen him?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Look Sid, a Buzz Burger. The Faz's favorite lunch. Sid reaches for the plate. Buzz walks over to the booth  and pulls his burger away from Sid.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Get away from that burger.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Sorry Faz, we didn't know you was here.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Buzz, Mr. Kastle wants to talk to you.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Are you guys bruddas?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: No, we ain't brothers.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: You know why we call him Breeze?

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Hey, cut it out Sid, that tickles. I'm serious! You guys are related, right?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: He's my dad.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Get your own.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: See that, toldja Sid. I knew I seen a resemblance.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Why don't you clowns get your whips and get lost.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Look, Faz, Mr. Kastle was not his usual charismatic self today when he told us to tell you...  What was that he said...?

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: I remember, Sid! Mr. Kastle says he don't like no sticky fingers in the till.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Pinhead! Don't just blurt it right out.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Your pop said to put these on his tab. Sid gets up and jerks his thumb towards the door.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: So Buzz, let's skedaddle. Mr. Kastle is waiting. As Buzz gets up, Theo rises and steps between his father and the two sleazeballs.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm coming with you.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Easy. I got business to do, Theo. I'll come back and haunt you later.  Don't say I never gave you nothing.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Do those two work for your dad or mine?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Mine, and they never tip.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Do you know where they're taking him?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Yeah, Babylon. Buzz runs the lanes there for my dad. Everybody who has anything to do with bowling in this town answers to my dad. Theo splits.

Speaker: junior
Dialogue: SHEILA!

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Buzz.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: You got my whip?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Lose yourselves.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: What's on your mind, Miles?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: We've been partners a long time now, haven't we Buzz?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Seven years.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: This scam we got going here was your

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: brainstorm, Buzz. I admit, I thought it was a rotten idea, but I put up the scratch.  And now we got a beautiful thing.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: It's a beautiful thing.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: A beautiful thing. And you know why Buzz? You know what we got? Buzz raises an eyebrow as he buttons his shirt.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: We got balance.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: A partnership is a very delicate balance. But let's say something tips the scales, maybe one partner takes more than his share, then... Kastle tips the wire man off his perch. The little motor squeals pathetically.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: ... oops. We got no more balance.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: And look at that; both partners go down together. Kastle shoves the sculpture onto the floor, stands up, and crushes it under his heel. He goes over and puts his arm around Buzz.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Simple math, Buzz.  Two plus two does not equal three.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Miles, I've always been on the square with you.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I'm sure you have Buzz.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Wish me luck.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Break a leg...  ...partner.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: My dentist told me this one the other day: How many bowlers does it take to screw in a lightbulb?

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: How many?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: It takes three bowlers to screw in a lightbulb. One to hold the bulb, one to turn the ladder, and one to hold their balls. Thank you, thank you. Just throw money.

Speaker: theo's pov
Dialogue: Through a crack in a door Theo can see Buzz standing in the spotlight.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I would like to draw your attention to the top of the lane.  Weighing in at sixty-nine pounds and standing exactly three feet - the diminutive dominatrix Teeny Weenie Tina the Terrible! The crowd CHEERS as the spotlight moves to Tina, a masked lady dwarf duded up in a combination black leather and cowhide western style S&M outfit. She CRACKS a whip and leers at the bowlers. They HOWL with excitement.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Don't be shy, folks!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: And - bowl 'er!

Speaker: tina's pov
Dialogue: The camera tracks low behind Tina as she crashes into the pins.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Seems to me like you ain't got much choice Buzz.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: You're between Miles Kastle and a hard place.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Aaay, hands off the tux!

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: The busyboy!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Get your hands off me, you moron.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What the fuck is this?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: What's it look like to you?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It looks like dwarf bowling.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Very good, busyboy.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Dwarf bowling's illegal.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: What are you gonna do, call the bowling police?

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Heh, heh, heh.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You said it would be unethical to help me. You call dwarf bowling ethical!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I do what I gotta do to survive.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You have no right to call yourself a bowler. Buzz slaps Theo in the face.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I'm more of a bowler than you'll ever be. I deal with my own shit. I ain't asking anyone to bail me out.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm your blood.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You wish!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You knew she was pregnant.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: What makes you so sure it was me? She coulda had lotsa bowlers! Theo rushes Buzz and grabs his arm. The two men struggle for the pin.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Don't say that about my mom!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I had a career. She wanted a little bowler of her own. Sid and Breeze leap into the fray, prying the two men apart. They wrestle Theo against a wall, pressing his face into the tiles.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Fuck you and fuck bowling.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: That's a laugh. You're all strung out. You're a bowling junkie.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I don't need the stinking pro-tour.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You're dead without the pro-tour, and you know it. Get him away from me. Sid and Breeze punch Theo in the face.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: You shoulda taken our advice, busyboy.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Waaaaaaaaah!

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Luna, that's the guy. I saw him do this spooky bowling rain dance on the bridge.

Speaker: luna
Dialogue: Typical.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Here Theo, it's the Fazeli specialty; a seven-ten split. Theo looks down the lane and sees the two pins standing.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm not here to - I can't...

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Bowling block.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Think he'll bowl it?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Nah, he won't do it.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Weird, comes into alleys and doesn't bowl.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: It's not an "Alley". I hate when people call it a "Bowling Alley", it's so common! I prefer "Bowling Center".

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: What's this guy here for, anyway?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Maybe he's here to pay his last respects.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Someone gonna get kacked, boss?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: If I find out Buzz is comin' up short on dwarf bowling, it's lights out for him and pink slips for you. Sid and Breeze look sideways at each other.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I hired you rent-a-thugs to keep tabs on the Faz. I want you all over him like a tent. Find out how that little weasel's ripping me off. Buzz Fazeli's gonna blow the lid off dwarf bowling!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I came here to have a word with your dad.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: What do you want with my dad?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Business.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Won't your father help you with that?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Having a legend for a dad isn't all it's cracked up to be.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Your dad's one of the only nice people in this fucking town. My Dad is slime. Kastle walks over. Theo stands up and shakes Kastle's proffered hand.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: So you're Buzz's boy. I've been expecting you. You hurt my feelings when you didn't come and see me sooner.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You know who I am?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Nobody sticks a finger into a bowling ball in this town without Miles Kastle knowing about it. You don't mind if I have a word with Theo, do you bunny? Kastle takes Theo by the elbow and pulls him away.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I heard you've been having a little trouble with the Congress.  Theo pulls his eyes off Sheila. Kastle walks Theo past pairs of bowlers.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You might say I'm at the top of their shit list.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Maybe I can help you.  I've seen tapes of you bowling on the circuit. You got Fazeli blood running through you. Your pop was a genuine talent in his day.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What's with the bad air between you two, Mr. Kastle?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: How's Gloria's thumb?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: No pain, no gain! Keep trying the ice. Chin up, sweetie.  This place is a bowling oasis.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It's very...clean.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Hello, Violet. How's my favorite 'bowlerina' doing?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: You keep that up Carmelita and one day you'll be a champion just like Mr. Skinner here. What do you think, Theo? Think Carmelita's got the stuff?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: That's some pinfall. Almost a 133 average. Her ball's flat, she needs to work on her spin control.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: That's right, didn't you have a slight control problem in a recent tournament,champ?  Come on, we're making her nervous.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I get them while they're young. Builds loyalty.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Four or five years when a girl like that's bowling on the pro tour for Team Kastle, she'll pay a handsome profit on my investment.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: And the dwarf bowling?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Profits down there, philanthropy up here.  Besides, it beats the pants off bingo.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Nice set-up.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: If it springs a leak, it'll be because Buzz is making waves.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What if he wants to get out?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I wanna show you something.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: Rac. R-A-C. Renovate, Automate, Computerize. That, my boy, is the future. One of the monitors shows a little girl bowling. Her ball moves so slowly it barely tips over the first pin. Kastle hits a key and the pins explode in an emphatic strike. The little girl jumps with joy.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What ever happened to just bowling?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: There's a lot of competition for amusement out there. You gotta adapt to survive.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I like the sport the way it is.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: A guy like you could breathe some fire into bowling. You got ambition like a...like a...blowtorch. You go for what you want and anything that gets in your way - PSSSHHT! -  shish kebabs.  I think I could help you, Theo.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: How Mr. Kastle?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: You need a sponsor; I have influence. I could sponsor you.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Why would you help me?

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: I like you, Theo. You bowl with soul.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: But, now that you mention it, you could afford me one minor dispensation. Theo follows his gaze to the screen.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: While you're in town, I need you to keep an eye on my daughter for a couple of days. Her big brother broke out of the mental hospital... Theo's eyes glaze over, the lights in the office dim, and Kastle seems to recede into the far distance.

Speaker: junior
Dialogue: SHEILA!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I could do that.

Speaker: kastle
Dialogue: One thing,  keep the meat in the freezer.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: This is a vicious cycle.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: I think that a motorbike is one of the last really free things that people can do.

Speaker: theo

Dialogue: So, Buzz was stooling for you guys.

Dialogue: You call it stooling, we call it cooperating. Breeze looks under Theo's car.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Did you know you were parked in the handicap space?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Kastle's daughter's been lookin' for you.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: She told us you went after Junior to save your old man's hide. You got some balls goin' after that psycho.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Only problem is, you didn't put his lights out, you just got him mad. Then he took it out on poor Faz, God rest his soul. Theo patches out.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Think he bought it?

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: I'd buy it!

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Once my father walked in on me while I was making Barbie and Ken do it. He freaked. I was seven. He took all my dolls away from me and cut them in half. He gave the top halves back to

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: me. Then he made me watch him burn the bottom halves in the fireplace. Theo kneels down nearby and throws a Barbie onto the bonfire. It goes up with a WHOOSH.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: I can see Junior's face in the fire.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Why did you come back?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: When I'm with you Sheila, I don't even think about bowling. Theo takes Sheila in his arms and kisses her passionately. She stops him and looks around nervously.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: If Junior finds us, he'll kill us both.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I killed him once, I'll just have to kill him again.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: You don't get two chances with Junior.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: At least I'll die smiling.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: And you only get two chances with me.

Speaker: fire
Dialogue: The shirt CRACKLES and burns.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: What's it gonna be, Theo?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: What's the plan, Theo?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Say something, Theo. Give me something. A doll's legs catch fire. Theo stares into Sheila's eyes.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Plan C. From now on it's gonna be plan C. Both bodies throb and grind, their sandy hands sliding over each others' sweaty skin.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It's gonna be you, Sheila.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: He died so that we could bowl - with dignity. Millie, decked out in mourning black, lets out a wail, steps up and throws a bouquet of flowers onto the coffin.

Speaker: millie
Dialogue: I forgive you Buzz.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: See ya 'round Faz.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: These are all your perfect games.  Bowl with God, Buzz.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Maybe you were right Buzz. Maybe I did just come here to take it out on somebody. But, I had to find my father... The muffled BEEPING of "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head" begins playing from inside the coffin. Theo's body jolts. He runs after Sheila who is walking towards her scooter.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Buzz is alive, Sheila.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Theo, Buzz is dead.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I didn't come this far to bury a guy that's not my dad. He owes me.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Back to plan A. The vicious cycle all over again. Theo lets go of Sheila.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: I've been trapped by Miles Kastle my whole life. She walks over to her scooter, and mounts it.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Now he's the one who's locked up and I'm the one who's free. If I gotta do this alone, I might as well start now. She revs up and peals out.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: SSHHEEIILLAAA!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Why is Junior's watch in that coffin? Something stinks around here.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Your time is up, busyboy.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Who identified the body?

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: The body was identified along proper Bowling Congress guidelines for processing a bowling related fatality.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm the next of kin. I should've seen him.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: After we ID, we bury the body. Case and casket closed.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You tried to make it look like Junior trashed his place. Junior's underground in that coffin you dicks put him in.

Speaker: breeze
Dialogue: It's splitsville for you.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB OUT!:BOWLING LEGEND KACKED BY DWARFSCAM KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.

Speaker: sid
Dialogue: It's official, you're an orphan.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What makes you think you know me so well that you can give me an ultimatum? Huh?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Who said anything about an ultimatum? You want to find your father? Get a shovel and start digging. Hurry up, he's probably in Purgatory by now. Sheila makes a pathetic attempt to speed away from Theo. He moves up beside her again.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You're really pissing me off.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: I'm pissing you off? I'm doing what I said I'd do. What the hell are you doing? What about your word?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: My word is good, and it'll always be good. When did I ever give my word to you?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: What about plan C?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Fuck plan C!

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Your word is so good, you're never gonna give it to anyone.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You think I'm dumping you to get back into bowling. Well who's dumping who?

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: I'm not dumping you, I'm suspending you.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Sez you!

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Suck my dick!

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Paradise.

Speaker: alfreda
Dialogue: You a mini-golfer?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: alfreda
Dialogue: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.

Speaker: alfreda
Dialogue: Can I get you something for the road?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You have orange whips?

Speaker: alfreda
Dialogue: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: No. I'm from Akron.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Strokin'. Here goes nothin'.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Yippy!

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Get away from me!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Hi Dad.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Dad? You said you was single.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: We ain't married no more.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: He says that to all his wives.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Geez Maynard, is he telling the truth?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Don't pay him any mind, sweetheart.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: You're a nice guy, Maynard, but if you got two wives - I ain't into no polybigamy. Buzz is silent. He takes the club out of her hand. She steps away - startled - then turns and jogs away. Buzz throws down his club in a fury.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Goddam it! I was just about to make a love connection. You sure got a way with women. You show up, women get away.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: The whole world thinks you're underground.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I am underground.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: It could just as easily have been me in that box.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I told you to get lost. You forced yourself into this mess, so the mess accommodated you. Buzz straightens out and carefully remolds the bent out of shape halo.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: What about bowling?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Bowling died for me years ago. Besides, I'm a living dead legend. I'm a hero.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You're a scumbag.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I'm a live scumbag.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: Nice knowing you, dad.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: So, eh, you never saw me. Right?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I never saw you.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Thanks, kid.  Where are you goin' now?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I'm goin' straight. No more short cuts. Theo gets into the car. Buzz leans in the open window.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Listen, if straight doesn't work out, you come work for me.  Just make sure nobody's following you. Buzz's face is eerily lit by the glow of the sunset, his halo bouncing in the breeze.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: I didn't mean that stuff I said. I was trying to keep you out of this muddle. I'm glad I didn't have my tubes tied. Oh, and by the way, I made a call for you before I - uh - retired. Buzz takes his card and scrawl on the back with a gold pen.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Don't say I never gave you nothing.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: See ya 'round Maynard.

Speaker: luna
Dialogue: Theo! Howya doin'?

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Theo! Hey, Theo's back!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Hello there, stranger.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Waaaaaaaaaaah!

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Very professional.

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I am a professional man.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Lips still for sale?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: Can you change something this big?

Speaker: theo
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: sheila
Dialogue: You'll owe me.
